fields.headline: What's new?
fields.bodyText: Liver birds compete Ryanair (0871 246 0000; ryanair.com) is to take on EasyJet at Liverpool with nine routes launching from the airport next spring. The Irish carrier's flights to Barcelona (Reus) and Murcia in southeast Spain are likely to provide competition for EasyJet's Barcelona and Alicante routes; Ryanair's fares start at £35.30 return with a half-price offer currently running. EasyJet's fares are from £40.98 return. Other new destinations to be served from John Lennon airport are Limoges, Pisa, Cork, Shannon, Granada, Nimes and Venice. Ready 4 snow Free daily text-message snow reports will be available to skiers in Three Valleys, France, from next month. Users register for SKI-TXT at 0044.co.uk, the foreign SIM card provider, and receive updates while away. The service may be extended to other European ski resorts later in the season. Mother India A scheme allowing visitors to southern India to stay with local families has been launched by Avion Holidays (0870 835 4531; avionholidays.co.uk). Guests can learn about cooking, farming and local education in the Keralan backwaters; a two-week tour including time in the village costs from £1,275pp. Belgrade mistake In Escape, 14 November we recommended visiting the National Museum in Belgrade. It is currently closed for refurbishment and not expected to reopen before 2006 at the earliest.
